title.narrative: Indonesia GCF Readiness Project Phase II

description.narrative: TBC

This Readiness proposal builds on the current Readiness project with the goal to develop a climate finance strategy and to support the Environmental Fund Management Agency/Badan Pengelolaan Dana Lingkungan Hidup (BPDLH) that will be formed at the end of 2019.

mailing-address.narrative: Global Green Growth Institute, 19F Jeongdong Bldg., 21-15 Jeongdong-gil, Jung-gu Seoul 04529 Republic of Korea

description.narrative: Expenditure
Incoming Funds

title.narrative: GCF Sub-Outcome 4.2: Alignment of Accredited Entity project pipeline development in alignment with Country Programmes

description.narrative: (D)AE dialogue reports

title.narrative: (D)AE dialogue reports are publicly available.
The Project Pipeline is continuously updated and in line with the CP
Climate finance strategies and project pipeline strengthened

description.narrative: 1. Climate finance strategy document 2. Advisory report for BPDLH 3. Final two CNs submitted to the GCF

title.narrative: A Climate Finance Strategy is developed. It also provides insight into where the BPDLH fits into this strategy.
At least 3 PCNs and proposals are strengthened and consistent with national priorities and 2 PCN submitted to the GCF
Potential private sector partnership identified
GCF Sub-Outcome 4.1: Climate finance strategy defines the potential use of a combination of funding options from public resources
and or the blending of financial instruments.
financing instruments such as loans, bonds, equity and others
private investment
tariffs, and international cooperation

description.narrative: 1. Climate finance strategy document 2. Report of recommendation on de-risking risking instruments for the BPDLH 3. Advisory report for BPDLH

title.narrative: A Climate Finance Strategy provides a clear overview of the climate finance landscape, opportunities and direction in Indonesia. It also provides insight into where the BPDLH fits into this strategy.
A recommendation on de-risking instruments for the BPDLH provided (report)
Advisory reports provided and the BPDLH adopted the majority of recommendation
GCF Sub-Outcome 2.3: Stakeholder engagement consultative processes

description.narrative: 1. Communication products (website contents, Op-Ed, etc.) 2. Reports of sectoral workshops

title.narrative: Governments, private sector, associations, civil society, academia and others engaged in consultative processes. Each event will be reported upon, which will be publicly shared on the website.

Inclusive communication products finalized and produced, among which: a. At least once a month update NDA website contents Press release during every major event (at least 3 releases) b. Op – Ed on national media at least twice a year c. Other communication products, as deemed necessary.
Country Programming Process established

description.narrative: 1. Communication products (website contents, Op-Ed, etc.) 2. Reports of sectoral workshops 3. Annual Participatory Review event reports 4. Guideline of gender/social inclusion for project developers

title.narrative: A step-by-step guideline for project developers on how to integrate gender/social inclusion into their projects is finalized and issued by the NDA
Governments, private sector, associations, civil society, academia and others engaged in consultative processes. Each event will be reported upon, which will be publicly shared on the website
Inclusive communication products finalized and produced.

Two participatory review meetings with participation from affected-people and communities, women and civil society. Verification through the meeting report including lesson learned (publicly available on the NDA website).
GCF Sub-Outcome 1.5: Effective coordination mechanism between NDA and National Designated Entity (NDE) for the UNFCCC Technology Mechanism and other climate finance focal points

description.narrative: 1. Minutes of the coordination meeting between NDA and other climate finance focal points in the country 2. A joint decree/ToR of coordination mechanism between NDA and other climate finance focal points

title.narrative: Coordination mechanism between NDA and other climate finance focal points established through a decree/joint decree or ToR.
Minutes of the coordination meetings between NDA and other climate finance focal points, including recommendations of collaboration and synergy raised in the meetings.
GCF Sub-Outcome 4.3: Project Concept Notes development

description.narrative: 1. Publication of the call for PCN 2. Roadshow event reports 3. Report on result of call for PCN including lesson learned 4. Final two CNs submitted to the GCF

title.narrative: A public call for PCN is published.
At least 2 PCNs submitted to the GCF
At least 3 PCNs and proposals are strengthened and consistent with national priorities.
At least 5 PCNs developed to a high-quality stage.
Four successful regional roadshows have been organized.
Matchmaking between PCNs, private sector and (D)AE’s has taken place.
GCF Sub-Outcome 3.2: Accreditation of direct access entities

description.narrative: 1. Submission/resubmission of accreditation to the GCF 2. Accreditation guideline for Indonesia entities

title.narrative: Accreditation applications of the two nominated DAEs’ submitted to the GCF.

Process and lessons learned documented through a report and country-specific guidance. The guidance will accommodate lessons learned from PT. SMI’s accreditation process as well as lessons from the accreditation of Kemitraan, IIF and new
Re-submission of accreditation applications by two nominated DAEs after addressing GCF Secretariat’s comments from the gap assessment.
Institutional capacity and coordination mechanisms in place to govern and coordinate climate action and finance

description.narrative: 1. The Exchange visit report 2. The updated capacity gap assessment document 3. The joint decree/ToR of coordination mechanism between NDA and other climate finance focal points

title.narrative: Coordination mechanism between NDA and other climate finance focal points established through a decree/joint decree or ToR.
Direct access to climate finance

description.narrative: 1. The accreditation guideline for Indonesia entities 2. The annual work programme of existing DAE

title.narrative: Accreditation guideline for Indonesia entities developed
Annual Work Programme (AWP) for all accredited entities finalized
GCF Sub-Outcome 1.1: NDA inter-institutional coordination mechanism

description.narrative: 1. The exchange visit report 2. The updated capacity gap assessment document

title.narrative: Lesson learned on the coordination mechanism between NDAs and other finance focal points in the country, and project pipeline development, which documented in a report.

The capacity of NDA strengthened and dedicated to performing functions expected of NDA, evidenced by an updated capacity gap assessment document that captures the before-and-after on the job training and support
GCF Sub-Outcome 2.2: Periodic participatory review and updating of the climate finance Country Programme

description.narrative: 1. Updated Annual Participatory Review (APR) mechanism 2. APR reports

title.narrative: Evaluation report of the existing Annual Participatory Review (APR) mechanism. The APR Mechanism is evaluated and updated (when necessary) based on the lesson learned report from the last two APR forums to ensure best approach has been conducted to reach out to all stakeholder, including vulnerable groups.

Two participatory review meetings (90 people per meeting) with participation from affected-people and communities, women and civil society. Verification through the meeting reports, including lessons learned (publicly available on the NDA website).
GCF Sub-Outcome 2.4: Gender issues considered in climate finance programming

description.narrative: Guideline of gender/social inclusion for project developers

title.narrative: 1. A step-by-step guideline for project developers on how to integrate gender/social inclusion into their projects is finalized and issued by the NDA.
GCF Sub-Outcome 4.5 Private Sector Engagement

description.narrative: Minutes/event reports on private sector awareness

title.narrative: Meeting/consultation reports including list of participants from the private sector with awareness of GCF project opportunities increased.
Potential private sector identified
International climate finance and private sector investment mobilized to support the achievement of Indonesia’s Nationally Determined Contribution (NDC) targets

description.narrative:
The GCF Interim Progress Report
The GCF Completion Report

title.narrative: A Climate Finance Strategy provides a clear overview of the climate finance landscape, opportunities and direction in Indonesia. It also provides insight in where the BPDLH fits into this strategy.
Coordination mechanism between NDA and other climate finance focal points established through a decree/joint decree or ToR
Meeting/consultation reports between the NDA with (D)AEs, sectoral stakeholders, including private sector

Process and lessons learned documented through a report and country-specific guidance. The guidance accommodates lessons learned from PT. SMI’s accreditation process as well as lessons from the accreditation of Kemitraan, IIF and new potential DAEs.
The readiness completion report submitted to and approved by the GCF
GCF Sub-Outcome 3.3: Direct Access Entity’s (DAE) Work Programme alignment with Country Programme
